s.text: The market-clearing price at 10 a.m., in other words, will not be the market-clearing price at noon or at 3 p.m., and that's true for all stocks, not just IPOs.
The filing price can be adjusted upward if demand is strong enough, but in general the offering price for a company going public is considerably below the market-clearing price.
As a result, investors who are able to get in on an IPO have a very good chance of reaping some easy gains.
As a result, investors who are able to get in on an IPO have a very good chance of reaping some easy gains.
